page.title: 09Post Office & Bank.
page.content: The postman leaves the post office about 7.00am, collects the mails from the pillar boxes round the island of Bernera and takes them to Callanish P.O. There he picks up the island mails, returns to Bernera, sorts the mails and then delivers them round the villages. The postmistress, who owns the Post Office, collects a certain amount of money every two weeks from the travelling bank. This money is used for things like pensions, child benefit, unemployment benefit and such things. The travelling bank comes to Bernera every two weeks. Weavers and other people who get paid by cheque have to go to the bank as it tours the island to have them cashed.
